top_categories.workout_context: Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic's extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 84 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
107ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic. Train it until it feels boring.
9,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At mile 60 of 84, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
9,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Smooth pedaling at 84 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Low-cadence force work for 9,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 84 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 84 miles of extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens in Santa Clara, Utah.
